titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Zen Center of Los Angeles records, 1937-2012 LSC.2299
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Douglas Johnson, 2017.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2020 February 21.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-05 14:53:33 -0700.

did.unittitle: Zen Center of Los Angeles records

physdesc.extent: (83 boxes, 5 cartons, 3 shoe boxes, 58 flat boxes, 2 oversize flat boxes, 1 phonograph box)

did.abstract: The Zen Center of Los Angeles (ZCLA) was founded in 1967 by Taizan Maezumi. Associated with the Soto Zen sect, it provides Buddhist teaching and training to both lay people and monks. This collection spans 1937-2012 and primarily consists of teaching materials, which are both written materials and audio recordings. The collection also includes book manuscripts, Maezumi Roshi's notebooks and personal files, and ZCLA administrative records.
did.physloc: Portions of the collection stored off-site. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Material is predominantly in English and Japanese. There are also items in Chinese, Korean, French, German, and Spanish.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Portions of this collection are closed until the November 26, 2034 due to donor-imposed restrictions. Box 151 is unavailable for access.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL AND DIGITAL MATERIALS: Digital and audiovisual materials are not currently available for access and will require further processing and assessment. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Zen Center of Los Angeles records (Collection 2299). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Zen Center of Los Angeles, 2012.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Zen Center of Los Angeles (ZCLA) was founded in 1967 by Taizan Maezumi Roshi. Associated with the Soto Zen sect, ZCLA provides teaching and training to both lay people and monks. ZCLA provides classes, intensive meditation, Buddhist services, workshops, and opportunities for service. Maezumi Roshi was born in Japan on February 24, 191. His father was Soto priest and he was ordained as a novice monk in the Soto lineage at age eleven. He moved to the United States to serve as a priest at the Zenshuji in Little Tokyo, Los Angeles. Maezumi Roshi also founded the White Plum Asanga and the Yokoji Zen Mountain Center. He died unexpectedly while on a trip to Japan in 1995. As of 2017, the Center is under the direction of Roshi Wendy Egyoku Nakao.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection spans 1937-2012, with the core of the collection consisting of teaching materials, which are in both written form and audio recordings. There are dozens of manuscripts for these presentations, or teishos, and approximately 2000 audio cassettes. There are also many book manuscripts in the form of drafts or galley proofs. These include both original works in English and Japanese and translations from Japanese and Chinese. Some of the translations appear to be unpublished. The collection also includes the personal notebooks of Maezumi Roshi. Mostly in Japanese, they appear to contain the notes he kept while preparing his teishos. There is also more personal material related to Maezumi Roshi, consisting of correspondence and many examples of his calligraphy. Also present are many of the Center's publications, as well as its administrative and financial records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged into the following series:
Series 1. Teaching materials, 1970-2002
Series 2. Book manuscripts, 1937-1992
Series 3. Taizan Maezumi Roshi notebooks, 1973-1989
Series 4. Taizan Maezumi Roshi personal files, 1969-1995
Series 5. Publications and printed material, 1955-2012
Series 6. Administrative files, 1969-2011
Series 7. Financial records, 1974-1994
Series 8. Audiovisual material, 1972-2006
Series 9. Books and periodicals, 2005-2006

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Ruth Strout McCandless Collection on Nyogen Senzaki (Collection 2296). Available at Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

controlaccess.subject: Zen Buddhism -- United States.
Maezumi, Hakuyu Taizan -- Archives.
controlaccess.corpname: Zen Center of Los Angeles -- Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains writings that appear to be intended for instruction activities within the Zen Center or affiliated locations. They include notes, lesson plans, formal lectures, and transcriptions of talks and class sessions. Most of the presentations were written by Maezumi Roshi. Some are as short as two pages long, while the lessons on the Book of Equanimity runs hundreds of pages.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: All Sentient Beings Have the Wisdom and Virtue of the Tathagata Buddha
Be Aware of What a Wonderful Thing We Are Doing
Closing the Gap Between Self and Self
Discrimination and Self-Nature The Foundation on Which We Can Stand & Live Together
Enmei Jukku Kannon Gyo: Prolonging Life Ten Phrase Avalokiteshvara Sutra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Maezumi Roshi's notes as well as material compiled after his death.

did.unittitle: Foot Patrol & Tozan's What Is Most Painful?
Fusatsu - Do Not Tell a Lie
Hokyo Zammai Ka: Jeweled Mirror Samadhi
Kai #2 - Non-Stealing: Put the Whole World in Heart
Koan of the Seven Wise Sisters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes in Japanese.

did.unittitle: Koryu Osaka Roshi - Questions and Answers
My Childhood by Hakuun Yasutani Roshi
On the Endeavor of the Way
On Zenshuji Conference: Americanization of Temple Structure
Segaki: the Service for Hungry Ghosts
Shakyamuni Buddha and I Are Practicing Together
Shudo, Ishii - seminars (translated by Albert Welter)
Shudo, Ishii - seminars (translated by David Putney)
Sixteen Stages of Counting the Breath
Tenzo Kyokun - Appreciating One's Life (Joyful Mind)
Wholeheartedly Sit and Clarify the Great Matter!
The Woodcutter and the Animal Called Satori

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuscripts intended for publication at various levels of completion by people associated with the Zen Center, including Maezumi Roshi, Robert Aitken, John Daido Loori, Taigen Daniel Leighton, and Steven S. Krause.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Manuscripts are listed alphabetically by author. Chinese authors are identified by the Library of Congress transliteration of their names, even if that differs from the transliteration in the work itself.

did.unittitle: Aitken, Robert - A Book about Basho's Haiku and Zen (penultmate typescript draft)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This was probably published as A Zen Wave; includes a foreword by W.S. Merwin.

did.unittitle: Burdick, Owen - Paschal Triptych and an essay: Stravinsky's Requiem Canticles

Dogen - Moon in a Dewdrop (edited by Kazuaki Tanahashi; translated by Reb Anderson, Ed Brown, Arnold Kotler, Dan Leighton, Lew Richmond, David Schneider, Kazuaki Tanashi, Katherine Thanas, Brian Unger, Mel Weitsman, Dan Welch, and Philip Whalen)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part Three, comprising pages 94-193, is missing.

Dogen - The True Eye of the Dharma Treasury in Chinese (typescript by unidentified translator)
Keizan - The Transmission of Light (typescript of translation by Thomas Cleary)
Kodera, Takashi James - Dogen's Formative Years in China: Historical Study and Annotated Translation of the Hokyo-Ki
Lao Tzu - Tao Te Ching (typescript translation by Steven S. Krause)
Liangje - The Record of Tung-shan Liang-chieh of Jui-chou (typescript by unidentified translator)
Linji - The Recorded Sayings of Ch'an Master Lin-Chi Hui-Chao of Chen Prefecture; compiled by his humble heir Hui-Jan of San-Sheng
Loori, John Daido - The Eight Gates of Zen
Loori, John Daido - The Mountain Record of Collected Zen Talks
Matthiessen, Peter - Nine Headed Dragon River
Sahn, Seung - The Whole World Is a Single Flower
Yuanwu - Hekigan Roku (typescript of translation by Yamada Koun and Robert Aitken)
Zhaozhou - The Collected Teachings of Zen Master Chao-Chou (translated by James Green)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probably published as The Recorded Sayings of Zen Master Joshu.

did.unittitle: Zhengjue - The Book of Serenity (typescript of translation by Thomas Cleary)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes several notes from Cleary.

did.unittitle: Zhengjue - Cultivating the Empty Field (galley proof of translation by Taigen Daniel Leighton with Yi Wu)
Zhengjue - Shoyo Roku (typescript translation by Maezumi Roshi and Dana Fraser)
Unidentified - Shobogenzo Genjo Koan: an Analytic Study

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of various notebooks and three-ring binders maintained by Taizan Maezumi Roshi. Each folder typically includes handwritten notes in Japanese and/or English as well as a several annotated texts in Japanese and English.

did.unittitle: Series 4. Taizan Maezumi Roshi personal files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material belonging to Maezumi Roshi but not directly related to his teaching. It consists mostly of personal correspondence and calligraphy. Many of the materials are in Japanese, including all of the calligraphy, journal and correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 151 of the correspondence is restricted until November 26, 2034 at the request of the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains two volumes of handwritten poetry by "Kyoshin," inspired by and dedicated to Maezumi Roshi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of periodicals published by the Center, ranging from the informal newsletters to the professionally published literary magazine ZCLA Journal. The printed material consists of short pamphlets and brochures, and in a few cases, photocopies of Japanese books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes the monthly newsletters circulated to members.

did.unittitle: Booklets, pamphlets, and other printed materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes: "Essentials and Symbols of the Buddhist Faith"; "Samma Samadhi: Being an Exposition of the Method of Samatha-Vipassana as Discovered & Attained by All Buddhas"; Institute of Asian Cultures material [in French and Japanese]; "Zen Flashes" by Roshi Egyoku Nakao.

did.unittitle: Booklets, pamphlets, and other printed materials in Japanese and Chinese

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material about the day-to-day operations of the Center, information about various programs and affiliated organizations, and member information.

did.unittitle: Calendars, date books, and address books
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in Japanese, with some in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains material related to Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur services held at ZCLA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains material relating to Maezumi's death; includes his last will and testament, condolence letters, information about memorial services, memorial issue of the journal Mountain Record, Fall 1995.

did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in Japanese with a small amount in English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains documents detailing how various classes and events at the center should be conducted.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: RESTRICTED MATERIAL. Social security numbers need to be redacted.

did.langmaterial: Material is primarily in English, with some in Japanese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This file contains material relating to the Zen school established by Maezumi Roshi. It includes correspondence, membership information, schedules and procedures for meetings, other administrative records, and a medal from the City College of New York.

did.unittitle: Yokoji Zen Mountain Center - plans and photographs

did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English, with some in Japanese.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series includes budget information, financial reports, bank statements, receipts, and donation records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Most of this material consists of recordings of teishos, seminars, lectures, and other events at the ZCLA.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL AND DIGITAL] MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The audio cassettes are mostly recordings of teishos, seminars, or lectures. They are typically labelled with a title, speaker, and date. There are approximately 2000 of them. Boxes 85-121 mostly contain talks by Maezumi Roshi, and boxes 122-140 mostly contain talks by others.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Ten discs of various talks.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED DIGITAL MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Four tapes, content unknown.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIO MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

did.unittitle: VHS, U-matic, and open reel videotape

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Thirty-four VHS cassettes, one Beta cassette (with a label in Korean), one U-matic tape, and one videotape reel. Most of the tapes appear to be of teishos or special services. A few are television programs or short films with some connection to Zen practice. Two of the tapes appear to be of Maezumi Roshi's funeral.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Ninety-nine CD-Rs in two three-ring binders with talks by various individuals.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS UNPROCESSED DIGITAL MATERIALS: Materials will require assessment and may need further processing for safe access. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

did.langmaterial: Material is in English, Japanese, German, and Spanish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Most of these are about Zen or other aspects of Buddhism, but there are also reference books and books about art.
